_comment: Created by NCODowd on 16/11/2016 17:22:21 using v2.7
title: How have rates of pressure ulcers in the community changed?
analysis_commentary: Incidence of pressure ulcers in community settings decreased from 8.8% of sampled patients in April 2012 to 4.5% of patients in November 2014. Since then, incidence has remained around 5%.This is still slightly here than in the acute setting, but the gap has narrowed considerably.
data_source: NHS Digital, NHS Safety Thermometer
